feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Supplier and Purchasing group email not picked in PO output message
entry.content:
Dear All

I am trying to send a email to purchase order supplier.  Output message is getting automatically determined in PO message as required. 

In message details, we could see the Supplier code (200025) and Purchasing group code (004) instead of email ID maintained for supplier and purchasing group.

On coming out of the message screen following warning messages are shown,

Email address 004 is not valid (Message no. APOC_OR_MESSAGES105). Similarly Email address 0000200025 for email role 'TO' is not valid (Message no. APOC_OR_MESSAGES105). Also email is not send to vendor. Output message status is In Preparation.

Email address maintained in supplier and purchasing group is correct. I double checked. Receiver and sender domain is maintained correctly.

Why email address is not shown instead of code? Why status is available In preparation?

Kindly advice

Regards

Suddy

entry.title: Service Order: Connection between service product and activity type
entry.content:
Hello experts!

I am new to service orders and am learning through the SAP test scripts using standard available data in the starter system of public cloud.

I have created a service order with the service material as SRV_01. The product master does not have any value , but the ongoing planned cost is populated automatically with 42 CAD: 

 

My guess is this is coming from the activity rate defined with respect to activity type SV01 and one of the cost centers in company code 2910:

If my assumption is true, how the activity type is connected to material? I found a config node where we actually can assign activity type to a service material, but I found no entry with this specific material SRV_01:

I could not even find any connection between activity type and some other material attribute such as item category. 

 

Not sure if I am looking into right places or having correct assumptions. Any insight/guidance would be really appreciated.

 

Thank you

Deep

entry.title: How Can We Consume Standard APIs With Business Users in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
I'm currently working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud project and have a question regarding API consumption from a business user perspective.

I’m already familiar with the technical setup — using communication users, communication arrangements, and communication systems to consume standard APIs.

However, my current need is different:
Is there a way for a business user (not a communication/technical user) to access or consume SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud standard APIs?

entry.title: Clarification on Project Validation BAdI (Enterprise Project) – Feasibility of External API Call
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently testing part of a customer requirement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. The ultimate goal of this implementation is to trigger an API call to an external system in order to provide notifications whenever an Enterprise Project is created or released.

Since this request comes from a potential customer evaluation, a clear answer is critical and time-sensitive. We would therefore highly appreciate your guidance at the earliest possible time.

For this purpose, we are analyzing the Business Add-In (BAdI) in the Project Structure (PPM-SCL-STR) component, specifically the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. Reference: Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. During our evaluation, we identified three main points for clarification:

1. BAdI Release Status for Developer Extensibility

  • The Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is currently released only for Key User Extensibility and is not released for Developer Extensibility.

  • We would like to confirm whether it is possible to request SAP to release this BAdI for Developer Extensibility as well.

  • From our understanding, such requests must be submitted through the SAP Customer Influence program, but this does not guarantee approval and the process may take significant time. Could you please confirm whether there are any other alternatives available in the meantime?

2. Feasibility of External POST Call from Custom Logic

  • If enabling Developer Extensibility is not feasible in the short term, we would like to know whether it is technically possible to perform an HTTP POST call directly from the Custom Logic implementation of this BAdI.

  • We have already created the Communication Scenario and Outbound Service in ADT, and the Communication System and Communication Arrangement in the tenant are configured correctly.

  • Our main question is whether outbound communication is permitted from Custom Logic, and if so, we kindly request sample code or reference documentation to validate the approach.

3. Reference Case – Purchase Requisition BAdI

As a reference, we reviewed the Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI, which is released for both Key User Extensibility and Developer Extensibility. Reference: Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI.

  • In this case, it seems possible to implement outbound API calls using ADT with Developer Extensibility. Could you please confirm whether our assumption is correct?

  • Additionally, once the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is released for Developer Extensibility, would a similar outbound communication approach be feasible?


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ABAP Extensibility

entry.title: RFUI: Default Presentation Device field – Enter key does not trigger submit on mobile (Velocity)
entry.content:
We are using the RFUI (SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition Warehouse Management) to log on with fields Warehouse, Resource and Default Presentation Device.

  • On desktop browsers (Chrome): after filling Resource and pressing Enter, the system validates the entry and automatically fills the Default Presentation Device (based on customizing Resource → Default Presentation Device). Pressing Enter again continues the logon.

  • On mobile devices (Zebra scanners with Android + Chrome/Velocity): pressing Enter after filling Resource does not trigger validation. As a result:

    • The Default Presentation Device is not automatically filled, even though customizing exists.

    • Pressing Enter in the Default Presentation Device field also does not trigger submit; users are forced to press the OK button.

This leads to inconsistent behavior: desktop Enter = submit, mobile Enter = no action.

Impact:

  • Users on scanners cannot log in by pressing Enter (physical keyboard & virtual keyboard), which breaks standard RF process flows.

Expected behavior:

  • Enter key should trigger the same validation/submit on mobile as it does on desktop.

  • Resource → Default Presentation Device assignment should work identically on both desktop and mobile.

Possible fix:

  • Using Ivanti Velocity Console, we can remap the hardware/software Enter key (keycode 66) to Tab or OK event. This forces the validation/submit to trigger, and the Default Presentation Device is then filled. Could this be the solution?

Request to SAP:

  • Please confirm if this difference is a known limitation (by design) in RFUI.

  • If so, provide the relevant SAP Note or documentation.

  • If not, we kindly request a correction so that the Enter key on Android/Velocity is handled the same as on desktop browsers (triggering validation and form submit).

Scope

Should this be in scope of the suppliers of the scanners (they imaged the scanners) of is this in scope of functional SAP consultants.

entry.title: Build custom report to check weekly/monthly demand & supply in MD04
entry.content:
Dear SAP expert,

We need build a custom report for the user to check weekly/monthly demand & supply in MD04 for multiple materials.

We found the bapi "BAPI_MATERIAL_STOCK_REQ_LIST", but it cannot be used directly. Is there any CDS view that store the same data, or any other method to get the data directly? Thanks!

Best regards,

Joey

entry.title: Export software collection.
entry.content:
1. Go to Export software collection App 
  2. Select the objects in Content section then choose check and deleted Items
  3. Then export .

 

 

Dont worry it will take some time  In Cloud .

entry.title: What's the best way to see material stock and history data in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I need to find information about material stock and its history. Previously, we could use tables like MARDH and MSKUH, but in the public cloud, we can only access this information via released CDS views.

I'm having trouble finding CDS views that are similar to these tables. 

All the tables that I'm looking for: MSPR, MSKU, MARD, MARDH, MSKA, MSKAH, MSPRH, MSKUH, MSLBH.

Has anyone found a way to access this data?

Kind regards,

Marcelo Romeiro

entry.title: Embedded Analytics S/4HANAPublic Cloud Guide?
entry.content:
Hello lovely SAP Community,

I’m currently a bit confused about the possibilities of Embedded Analytics in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

There seem to be quite a few apps available, such as:

  • Customer Data Browser

  • View Browser

  • Query Browser

  • Manage Reports and KPIs

  • Custom CDS Views

Is there a good guide that explains how to use these apps in practice? There Imo not very user friendly.

What I’d like to do is:

  • Create dashboards

  • Define my own KPIs

  • Build custom reports

If any of you could point me towards a useful guide or share some best practices, I’d really appreciate it!

Kind regards,
Philipp

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Issue with Default "Tax Calculation Brazil" in Customer BP Master Data
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently engaged in an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud implementation project for a client in South Korea.

Problem Description: While setting up Business Partner (BP) master data, specifically for the Customer (Fin. Accounting) BP Role, I've noticed an anomaly. On the Customer: Tax Data tab, there's an entry for "Tax Calculation Brazil" that shouldn't be there. [I want to set it as "Tax Calculation: South Korea" instead]. Our project is entirely focused on South Korea, and no Central Business Configuration (CBC) settings related to Brazil have been made for this project.

Goal: I need to remove/delete this "Tax Calculation Brazil" entry and ensure that only the relevant tax calculation settings for South Korea are present and applicable for this Business Partner.

Question: Could anyone advise on the best approach to resolve this? Is there a specific transaction, configuration step, or master data change process to delete such an incorrect tax entry from a Business Partner, or to reset the tax data section?

Your expertise and insights would be extremely helpful. 

Thank you for your time and assistance,

Best regards,

entry.title: Plant Transfer via PO-SO Process Between GST-Registered Units Within Same Company Code
entry.content:
Dear Team,

There is a plant-to-plant transfer within the same company, involving two different GST registrations. The process must include entries from the Procurement, Sales, and Finance sides. We have already tried the STO and OTC processes; however, the requirement is to initiate the transfer through a Sales Order (SO) with reference to a Purchase Order (PO). How do I proceed with this scenario in SAP S4 Hana Public Cloud? 

Thanks in advance!

Vivek Paul D

entry.title: Cross-Company Code Cash Application – Withholding Tax Issue
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We received the cash receipt/bank statement in company code DE01, but the invoice we are trying to apply the payment to was created in FR01. When attempting to apply the cash directly, we encounter a tax error stating:

"Company Codes have different settings for withholding tax treatment."

As a workaround, we currently follow this process:

  • We post the bank statement on account to company code FR01.
  • Then, we use the "Clear Incoming Payments – Manual Clearing" app to apply the cash to the customer invoice.                                                                                                                                              

This method works, but it involves manual steps. I’d like to explore whether there’s a more efficient or automated solution. Specifically:

Is there a configuration change or system adjustment that could eliminate the need for manual clearing?
Can the system be set up to allow direct application of cash across company codes with different tax settings?

Thanks

Naveen Kumar
